content:
For a science project Nick looked up the average annual snowfall for $6$ cities in the northern hemisphere, and he also recorded the latitude of each city.  Nick used the line $y = 3.5x - 40$ to model annual snowfall as a function of latitude.  The table below shows the residuals generated by this model.  

**In the table below, calculate the data values for each point.  Then plot the data on the graph below.**  

**Would an exponential or quadratic model be a better fit for the data?**  [[☃ dropdown 1]]  

 | | | || ||
- | - | -
**Latitude (degrees north)** |$10$ | $20$| $30$ | $40$ | $50$|$60$
**Residual value** | $5$ | $-15$| $-5$ | $5$|$0$|$10$  
**Snowfall (cm)** | [[☃ input-number 1]] | [[☃ input-number 2]]|  [[☃ input-number 3]]| [[☃ input-number 4]]|[[☃ input-number 5]]|[[☃ input-number 6]] 

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]
